definition: sheng, a free reed wind instrument with vertical bamboo pipes
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
Du Yuesheng (1888-1951), Shanghai secret-society leader, banker, industrialist
reed-pipe wind instrument with a keyboard
reed-pipe wind instrument and vertical bamboo flute
pipe wind instrument introduced from the non-Han peoples in the North and West

sentences.english: It can be said that the reforms of Sheng should be particularly cautious.
sentences.chinese: 可以說，笙在改革方向的選擇上尤應慎重。

sentences.english: Sheng is a mouth-blown free reed instrument consisting essentially of vertical bamboo pipes.
sentences.chinese: 笙是一種簧管類樂器，由一定數目的竹筒及簧片組成。

sentences.english: As he walked with the sheep, he blew upon his musical pipes.
sentences.chinese: 當他走在羊羣中，他吹着笙笛。

sentences.english: The shapes of the Hulusheng vary in different places.
sentences.chinese: 葫蘆笙的形狀因地而異。

definition: guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
yueqin, a lute with oval or octagonal sound box
Yao ethnic group of southwest China and southeast Asia/surname Yao
cold/to shiver with cold/to tremble with fear/afraid/apprehensive/strict/stern/severe/austere/awe-inspiring/imposing/majestic
liuqin lute, smaller version of the pipa 琵琶, with holes in the soundbox, and range similar to that of a violin
